page.title: 03Farms
page.content: Lower Westfield Farm cont. most of the grain had to be dried before sale because of the wet summer.There is a bungalow near the main farm building which is normally used to house farmworkers but at the time of our visit was used as a holiday home. The main crops grown were potatoes and wheat-with some winter wheat grown for animal feed. Most of the animals were beef cattle which were bought as calves and sallowed to graze on open pasture for about 18 months before being sold. Lower Westfield Farm adjoins Westfield Farm which also concentrates on mixed farming.It is owned by Mr. and Mrs.Worrall. Farmers in the region have often complained about low-flying R.A.F.jets which practise in the area ,and
